conclusion: Determine how shadows A, B, C, and D change when light source moves to the back right.
Shadow of apple is to the left side of the apple.
Light source is positioned toward the front-left relative to the apple.
Shadow of paper is to the right of the paper.
Light source is toward the back-right relative to the paper.
Shadow of glass is below and slightly to the left of the glass.
Light source is in the front-left relative to the glass.
Shadow of chicken leg is to the right of the chicken leg and slightly behind it.
Light source is in the back-right relative to the chicken leg.
Moving light source to the back-right means light rays come from back-right direction.
Shadow of apple will shift to the front-left of the apple.
Shadow of paper will shift towards the front-left.
Shadow of glass will move closer to the object itself, creating a smaller shadow.
Shadow of chicken leg will shift towards the front-left, closer to the object.
Final answer: A's shadow shifts to front-left, B's shadow shifts to front-left, C's shadow becomes smaller and closer, D's shadow shifts to front-left.
